alert.note: Alert for Bath; Fleming; Rowan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 12:56PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Bath, Fleming and northwestern Rowan Counties through 130 PM EDT... At 1256 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Tilton, or near Flemingsburg, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Flemingsburg and Oakley around 100 PM EDT. Poplar Plains, Hillsboro and Grange City around 105 PM EDT. Goddard, Wallingford and Ringos Mills around 110 PM EDT. Plummers Landing around 115 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Muses Mills, Waltz, Cranston and Triplett. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 64 in eastern Kentucky between mile markers 142 and 149. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 600 PM EDT for east central Kentucky.
